ETYMOLOGY: From virtual (adj.) + -ly (adv. suffix). Virtual derives from Middle English virtuall, from Medieval Latin virtualis, from Latin virtus (power, strength, virtue).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, expressing manner, time, place, etc.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The concert hall was virtually empty because of the snowstorm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 因为暴风雪，音乐厅几乎是空的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, expressing manner, time, place, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: By means of computer simulation or technology; in a virtual environment.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 通过虚拟手段；在虚拟环境中；线上地。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Since the pandemic, many companies are interviewing candidates virtually.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 自从疫情以来，许多公司都通过线上虚拟方式面试候选人。
